parameters.name: model
parameters.description: AI model used to process submitted audio. Default: `general`. Learn More

parameters.name: tier
parameters.description: Level of model you would like to use in your request. Default: `base`. Learn More

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Version of the model to use. Default: `latest`. Learn More

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The <> language tag that hints at the primary spoken language. Default: `en`. Learn More

parameters.name: detect_language
parameters.description: Detect the language of the provided audio. Default: `false`. Learn More

parameters.name: punctuate
parameters.description: Add punctuation and capitalization to the transcript. Default: `false`. Learn More

parameters.name: profanity_filter
parameters.description: Remove profanity from the transcript. Default: `false`. Learn More

parameters.name: redact
parameters.description: Redact sensitive information, replacing redacted content with asterisks (*). Can send multiple instances in query string (for example, redact=pci&redact=numbers). Default: `false`. Learn More

parameters.name: diarize
parameters.description: Recognize speaker changes. Each word in the transcript will be assigned a speaker number starting at 0. Default: `false`. Learn More

parameters.name: diarize_version
parameters.description: Version of the diarization feature to use. Only used when the diarization feature is enabled (diarize=true is passed to the API). Learn More

parameters.name: smart_format
parameters.description: Apply formatting to transcript output. When set to true, additional formatting will be applied to transcripts to improve readability. Default: `false`. Learn More

parameters.name: multichannel
parameters.description: Transcribe each audio channel independently. Default: `false`. Learn More

parameters.name: alternatives
parameters.description: Number of transcripts to return per request. Default: `1`.

parameters.name: numerals
parameters.description: Convert numbers from written format (e.g., one) to numerical format (e.g., 1). Default: `false`. Learn More

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Terms or phrases to search for in the submitted audio. Can send multiple instances in query string (for example, search=speech&search=Friday). Learn More

parameters.name: replace
parameters.description: Terms or phrases to search for in the submitted audio and replace. Can send multiple instances in query string (for example, replace=this:that&replace=thisalso:thatalso). Learn More

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Callback URL to provide if you would like your submitted audio to be processed asynchronously. Learn More

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: Keywords to which the model should pay particular attention to boosting or suppressing to help it understand context. Can send multiple instances in query string (for example, keywords=medicine&keywords=prescription). Learn More

parameters.name: paragraphs
parameters.description: Split audio into paragraphs. Default: `false`. Learn More

parameters.name: summarize
parameters.description: Summarize content. Default: `false`. Learn More

parameters.name: detect_topics
parameters.description: Identify and extract key topics. Default: `false`. Learn More

parameters.name: utterances
parameters.description: Segment speech into meaningful units based on gaps in speech. Default: `false`. Learn More

parameters.name: utt_split
parameters.description: Length of time in seconds used to split utterances. Default: `0.8`. Learn More

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Tag to associate with the request. Learn More

url.description: URL of audio file to transcribe.

RAW_BODY.description:
Alternatively you can send raw binary audio data instead of a URL to hosted audio.

In this case, include a Content-Type header set to the audio MIME type.

transcript.example: and jessica christina we are so proud you you're gonna do great today we'll be waiting for you here in a couple hours when you get home i'm gonna hand you over to stephanie now have a great great eva drew thank you so much and our pleasure working with you this morning and i'm working on getting that easy hatch open and i can report it's opened and s thank drew thank you so much on your dc take your power switches to bat stagger switch throws and expect a warning tone final steps where they begin the space copy check display switch functional tracy how important is this the the guiding it the isn't like seems like a lot to remember on your own absolutely take power e b one e two two switches to us o f yeah christina jessica have enough work with their hands and feet and their brain outside that it really helps to have someone like stephanie you power both off connector your from your dc and s the in the pouch kinda the interrupt so not only does stephanie thirty eight am central time a little ahead of schedule about twelve minutes but that gets us started on today's historic space walk morgan there wishing the crew luck the made pouch and dc cover closed copy e two

err_msg.example: Content-type was application/json, but we could not process the JSON payload.

post.description: Creates a new key in the specified project

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the project for which you want to create a key.(UUID)

comment.description: Comments associated with the key you would like to create. Must be between 1 and 128 characters long, not including whitespace.

scopes.description: Scopes for the key you would like to create.

tags.description: Tags associated with the key you would like to create.

expiration_date.description:
Date on which the key you would like to create should expire.

For each key, you may specify either an expiration_date or a time_to_live_in_seconds, but not both.

time_to_live_in_seconds.description:
Length of time (in seconds) during which the key you would like to create will remain valid.

For each key, you may specify either an expiration_date or a time_to_live_in_seconds, but not both.

get.description: Generates a list of requests sent to the Deepgram API

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the project for which you want to retrieve requests. (UUID)

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start date of the requested date range. Formats accepted are YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS, or YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+HH:MM.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: End date of the requested date range. Formats accepted are YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS, or YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+HH:MM.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page. Default 10. Range [1,100].

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of requests to return. Enables you to filter requests depending on whether they have succeeded or failed. If not specified, returns requests with all statuses.

Result.value:
{
	"page": 0,
	"limit": 0,
	"requests": [
		{
			"request_id": "uuid",
			"created": "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD",
			"path": "string",
			"api_key_id": "uuid",

				"details": {

					"duration": 0,

			}

}

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start date of the requested date range. Format is YYYY-MM-DD. If a full timestamp is given, it will be truncated to a day. Dates are UTC.  Defaults to the date of your first request.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: End date of the requested date range. Format is YYYY-MM-DD. If a full timestamp is given, it will be truncated to a day. Dates are UTC.  Defaults to the current date.

get.description: Retrieves a summary of usage statistics

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the project for which you want to retrieve the specified request. (UUID)

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start date of the requested date range.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: End date of the requested date range.

parameters.name: accessor
parameters.description: Limits results to the given API key. To include multiple API Keys, send multiple instances in query string (e.g., accessor=2ed1...cfa4e&accessor=1dc0...bez3d).

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Limits results to requests associated with the specified tag. To include multiple tags, send multiple instances in query string (e.g., tag=dev&tag=production)

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: Limits results to requests processed using the specified method. To include multiple methods, send multiple instances in query string (e.g., method=sync&method=streaming).

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Limits results to requests run with the specified model UUID applied.

parameters.name: multichannel
parameters.description: Limits results to requests that include the `multichannel` feature.

parameters.name: interim_results
parameters.description: Limits results to requests that include the `interim_results` feature.

parameters.name: punctuate
parameters.description: Limits results to requests that include the `punctuate` feature.

parameters.name: ner
parameters.description: Limits results to requests that include the `ner` feature.

parameters.name: utterances
parameters.description: Limits results to requests that include the `utterances` feature.

parameters.name: replace
parameters.description: Limits results to requests that include the `replace` feature.

parameters.name: profanity_filter
parameters.description: Limits results to requests that include the `profanity_filter` feature.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: Limits results to requests that include the `keywords` feature.

parameters.name: detect_topics
parameters.description: Limits results to requests that include the `detect_topics` feature.

parameters.name: diarize
parameters.description: Limits results to requests that include the `diarize` feature.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Limits results to requests that include the `search` feature.

parameters.name: redact
parameters.description: Limits results to requests that include the `redact` feature.

parameters.name: alternatives
parameters.description: Limits results to requests that include the `alternatives` feature.

parameters.name: numerals
parameters.description: Limits results to requests that include the `numerals` feature.

parameters.name: smart_format
parameters.description: Limits results to requests that include the `smart_format` feature.

code-samples.code:
curl -X POST \                                                                                                                                300ms  Wed Jun 28 16:01:19 2023
    -H 'Authorization: Token aa4909ae0078f880a1e5846ed42e28adf8b31780' \
    -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
    --url https://api.deepgram.com/v1/projects/9f870faf-07a9-41b1-aa0d-de5030cb9bdc/onprem/distribution/credentials \
    --data '{"comment": "My on-prem distribution credentials", "scopes":["onprem:products"], "provider": "quay"}'
